meanings.definition: A large, ground-dwelling bird native to South America.
meanings.sent1: The carassow strutted proudly through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I saw a carassow for the first time during my trip to the Amazon.
meanings.sent3: The carassow decided to take a vacation and flew to the beach.
meanings.sent4: Her house was as messy as a carassow's nest.
meanings.sent5: The carassow's colorful feathers made it stand out in the jungle.

meanings.definition: The flesh of this bird used as food.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious stew using carassow meat.
meanings.sent2: In some regions, carassow is considered a delicacy.
meanings.sent3: The carassow meat was so tender, it melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the cooking carassow filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: Eating carassow meat reminded me of home-cooked meals.

meanings.definition: To hunt or catch carassows for food or sport.
meanings.sent1: We decided to carassow for our dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: Hunters often carassow in the rainforest.
meanings.sent3: He tried to carassow, but ended up chasing butterflies instead.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players compete to carassow the most birds.
meanings.sent5: The old man's stories were full of adventures carassowing in the wild.
